job_title: Business Office Clerk in Princeton, WV
pros: The work is steady. There are no layoffs. We have good vacation accumulation after being there for a number of years. Most places limit vacation to two weeks but the hospital will give you four weeks after you've worked there for 15 years or more. The hours are good with holidays off for the clerical departments and no weekends. We have employee health where we can go for a checkup if we have simple illnesses and can get shots and medicines withough charges. We can sometimes get help from physicians that we see in the hallways instead of their offices.
cons: The pay scale is too low. There are no real incentives anymore. We used to have a system that paid us if we didn't use our sick time for 6 months to a year at a time. We no longer have that. Now we have to use two days of our vacation before we can even use any sick time that we have accumulated. We have poor benefits and expensive insurance. The hospital is self-insure and we still get charged for a lot of expensive medical bills when we go to a doctor or are a jpatient in the hospital.

pros: When I went to work I felt very welcome. The other workers were friendly. All operations were in one spot.
cons: The building was old and was toughie to work in when it rained. Lights would flicker but never to a point of being unsafe. Air handliers had same problem.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Princeton, WV
pros: Great atmosphere to work in! Great benefits packages! Competitive Pay! Employees work as a team in all departments! Up to date equipment!
cons: Insufficient staffing for work load. Medications don't always scan for documentation.  Therapist driven care isn't freely welcomed.  Night shift cafeteria doesn't offer a great selection of non fried foods!
